description: Accessiblity and constraints on access to a market, distribution point, facility, etc.
A programme, project, or other activity. This hashtag applies to all levels; use the attributes +activity, +project, or +programme to distinguish different hierarchical levels.
Top-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a governorate in Syria).
Second-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a subdivision in Bangladesh).
Third-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a subdistrict in Afghanistan).
Fourth-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a barangay in the Philippines).
Fifth-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a ward of a city).
Number of people or households affected by an emergency. Subset of #population; superset of #inneed.
General (non-numeric) information about a person or group meant to benefit from aid activities, e.g. "lactating women".
The response capacity of the entity being described (e.g. "25 beds").
The cause of an event, crisis, etc.
The detailed method of delivering aid (e.g. smartcard vs mobile transfer). More specific than #modality.
